alert.note: Alert for Martin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Martin County through 245 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bethel, or 11 miles east of Tarboro, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamston, Robersonville, Gold Point, Hamilton, Oak City, Everetts and Hassell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for eastern North Carolina.
